posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

posts.com:
Ian Huntley had a strange obsession with learning Italian. He would often spend hours in his cell practicing his pronounciations, and would frequently be heard shouting "Ciao, bella!" to the prison guard who passed by his cell.

One day, Ian heard that the prison was offering a beginner's Italian course and immediately applied. But unfortunately, his application was rejected with a note that read "Why bother? You'll never see Italy and no one in your life speaks Italian"

Ian was not one to be discouraged that easily, he decided to appeal the decision and came up with a plan. He created a fake Italian pen pal named "Giovanni" and started to receive letters from him, filled with phrases like "Ti amo" and "Voglio mangiare pasta con te" (I love you, I want to eat pasta with you). He presented these letters as proof that he would need the language in the future.

The prison officials were not impressed by Ian's shenanigans and denied his appeal. Ian was undeterred, he knew he needed to take drastic measures. He started a hunger strike, refusing to eat anything but Italian food, demanding that they let him take the course. He even went as far as to refusing to wear clothes, unless they were Italian designer.

The strike caused quite a stir in the prison, with inmates taking sides, some supporting Ian's cause, others thinking he had lost his mind. The prison officials, not wanting to deal with a naked, pasta-loving prisoner, caved in and allowed Ian to take the course.

To everyone's surprise, Ian turned out to be a natural at the language, and soon graduated with honours, impressing even the most skeptical of prison officials. He became the prison's go-to translator for all things Italian, even translating love letters for inmates who had Italian penpals.

Finally, Ian's dream had come true, he was fluent in Italian, but unfortunately, he would never be able to use it on a trip to Italy, as he would be spending the rest of his life in prison.

Maybe you need to care more, not less. You're never not gonna be uncomfortable and sticky and panicky outta-breathy from that too hot feeling, so you would probably have to lay with someone who overrides all those senses, y'know?
I dunno man. I feel silly and presumptuous trying to speculate or give any sort of reply, let alone advice, when I don't know you well enough to be saying that kind of stuff. But obviously I want to reply, and then some, since you're brotier and I want you to know deep and lasting joy.
Relationships are hard. The "too" is up to you, plus the interplay of the person you choose to be with and who chooses and loves you, whether&/how they choose to show it..
Do you mean what you say when you say you
>wish
for that? Or is that another way of expressing something else you're critical of yourself about?
You could find a chick who is similarly concerned with personal physical comfort and isn't into the cuddly stuff. Yeah, that's the female norm, even with what you've talk about like "Fuck, chicks are naturally cold and I'm like a human space heater so they want my warmth but it makes me even hotter and it sucks," but then imagine how happy a girl who deviates from that default would be to find someone who doesn't see her as emotionally cold or less feminine for not being all cuddly.

Anyways. Big love. Always check the dumpsters, there's a schedule and usually it's the same old greasy burger wrappers, but you never know what surprise could be in store someday. But dumpster stuff is dumpster stuff and could blow to you on the wind anyways, so don't be obsessive about it. Maybe the odds of finding the right trash on the right day are about the same as a $100 bill smacking you in the face in a gale, bro, who knows. Either have fun rifling around in the refuse, or just let what will be, come.

>>71831106
Alas, I'm sadly out of ideas.

I've been in your position before. In the past, I've had coworkers who have been upset with me and avoid me outside of work. Sometimes it got to the point where they'd show up to work and purposefully ignore me, they wouldn't say "Hi" or make eye contact, and I know the feeling that forms inside of you. You look over at them, but you don't want to look too long because you don't want to stare, so you just keep throwing them these occasional glares until they're gone, and while you're doing that, there's this blob that forms inside of you, it sinks your stomach and chills your blood and constricts your spine, because you know they're doing it on purpose and there's nothing you can do about it.

This has happened to me twice. One of the issues I was able to resolve, but the other, I was unsuccessful with. I ended up trying to be rude towards them towards them in the end, just hoping that they'd say something to me, but nothing ever happened. I know you're thinking it's hypocritical of me to say this after my previous suggestion, but my incident had a lot of background to it as well as a lot of moving pieces, so it was a fairly different situation, but the feeling was still there.

The only advice I can offer to you now is to carry on as best as possible, until things begin to change. Carrying on and persevering is the best thing to do, even if it feels impossible, even if every time you see him a little piece of you dies, even if the sadness you harbour inside your souls feels as if it will never subside, you gotta keep carrying on, and just keep making your way through the storm. Focus your attention on your other coworkers and friends, even though it won't be the same, it'll be better than being alone. If you're religious, pray, and if you're not religious, then me and my friends will pray for you. You may not believe in God, but I'm sure He believes in you.

You got this.
You can do this.
Just keep going.

posts.name: TheSpaceBetween
posts.com:
I wrote this to help me and it has. Hope my words help you too.

Recognize overthinking, relax and let go of the negative thoughts. Why write a bad ending and bathe in it?

Don't react and take action to a negative assumption. Your past does not hold cause to effect your future. Action in form of reaction is having responding thoughts, a carried feeling, a mental image, a sustained belief, mentally, physically,verbally lashing out. Blaming, accusing.

Self acceptance and love is paramount.

Forgive yourself as you forgive others, forgive others as you forgive yourself.

Only think of the good in every single thing. Find the good in that thing and assume and define it by the best case of it.

My heart is my strength, honesty is my strength, communication is my strength. I am loved because i am me. I am my heart, my honesty, my communication. As I am loved for being me, I am only loved more for my true expression of these aspects of me.

Sharing my truth in vulnerability allows wounds to be healed, trust to grow. Withholding is disloyalty to my truth.

It's okay to feel emotion. Cry, let out, and when you are able re-align to your truth.

Absence does not make the heart grow fonder. The heart grows with love, and through expression of that love.

A background eraser works by highlighting and selecting the foreground. It does not work by selecting and highlighting the background. Let go of the the negative aspect, don't think of it or feel it in the slightest, hold on to and live in your paradise.

Dream in waves.
-
Mike

It came from being a goofy dude making friends with a girl, who was just otherworldly and amazing. Sitting in my shower and going "nah, couldn't happen, forget about it" and went to a potential future, that you put forward in the first place! Then that maybe, just maybe we could have a family. Summit every mountain to make it happen. Our Miracle Mile. Then you just got bored, at the last stretch. After all this effort we both put forward to travel the world for each other. We did, and it was more than dreams. It became tangible, beautiful and real. Saying over and over that you weren't going anywhere. And I trusted you. I hate being influenced by someone in such a profound way. I hate that I can't say "fuck you." I hate trying so hard just for you to suddenly decide indifference. I hate that I felt love for the first time, crushing every pathetic paper mache shadow I had propped up before. I hate that you said you browse this board. I hate that nobody can relate to this. I love you, I love you, I love you. So yeah. Here we are. GMI

What else is there to do?

A,

I dreamt of you, for the first time in years.

I saw us in a hotel. I stumbled into your room on accident, and saw that you were alone. You were on the bed, your feet under the quilt, your body wrapped up in another blanket.

We talked for a few seconds before your girlfriend came in. As soon as she entered, I left. These feelings that live inside of me are like a poison to my soul.

Every time I think I'm fine, I'm reminded of you, and your absence continues the corrosion and breaks me down even more every day. I don't know if you'll come back, or when you would.

You'll probably never see this, and it's probably for the best. I guess I should prepare myself for going on in life without you.

I don't want to schizo post so I'll try to keep this short.
I feel like I'm emotionally a very demanding person and I try to keep it at a minimum but it's hard. I need attention and I feel anxious if my girlfriend doesn't talk to me for a while out of nowhere. My girlfriend told me that she want's to watch a video and politely asked me to be quiet for a while and we'd talk after. I get that it's okay and I respect her saying it straight to me. So I stayed quiet and waited for her to talk to me. I waited an hour, two, three, four. And then I just went to sleep. I know I was being a stupid dog for waiting that long in the first place but I don't want to annoy her and respect her requests.

But now I don't even want to tell her I feel bad because it's all my fault in the first place. I feel like my brain is not working the same way it did when I was single. I'm so much more emotional and I hate it. This constant anxiety and need for validation and confirmation of existence is making me crazy. Before I was able to manage my emotions and make decisions without my emotions getting in the way but now I just feel like my emotions have taken over.

posts.com: Sometimes I think about you and whether it was possible for there to ever be an us. I can't say for sure that you were into me, but I can't say you weren't either. It's the not knowing that keeps these thoughts with me nearly 4 years later. I have tried everything to get over this, but I don't think I ever learned how to let things go. I guess that's just another thing I need to grow into. I can say for certain that even if things had worked out I wasn't ready. I thought for a long time that I was, but then again. If I was then I would have been able to express those feelings to you and leave them as they were if you rejected me. I took the cowards way and that's why I have these regrets. I will never know your true feelings for me. And these messages will never reach you. At least it doesn't make me feel sad anymore. In some way it makes me a feel a bit better to know that even if I was happy I still wasn't ready. Because I was happy when we spoke. Not because of you, or not exclusively. You did make me happy, but you made me happier. I hope that even if I meant nothing to you that I might have made your days a little lighter. That music track will forever be for you. I wish I could have shared those feelings with you, but the fear I felt then was overwhelming. Maybe one day I will finally find courage.

Take shid? No judgement here, Anon. I have found myself in your shoes more often than I would like, even to this day. But it is because of not taking my own advice, choosing to put my heart last. Making things worse by complicating them further. There is a feeling safety in a spiral, of feeling like you do not know where you are going, when the alternative seems certain and scary. There is a balance, there is an extent to which you can speak up for yourself and clearly, politely ask for the love you need before that circles back around to being unhealthy or even toxic. You do have to try your best to be okay. But you are not alone in a relationship, so you should not feel alone. If I knew every side, even just more aspects of your side, it would still be tricky to comment on. Again, challenge yourself to change, to grow, to be a little stronger. But that cannot and should not be the only thing. Do not let it get out of hand. I know it can be very validating to be loved even for your too-muchness, but do not let that be the thing that decides how much of your hurt and neediness you express, if you have the ability to still be honest with your girlfriend without poisoning or draining. There is a middle ground, so find it. So you can be loved for 100% of what makes you you, but so you can also be proud of giving 110%, of being able to love yourself hard enough it makes it easier for your girlfriend to show how much she loves you.
*crosses fingers*
I think ideally, but logically, and speak from experience. This is the method I chose tonight.

Anon I know it's become your thing and it keeps the thread alive but pls stop talking shit about things you know nothing about. Cmon man, it's hurting other anons with misinformation, we've been over this several times.

To other anons struggling with ADHD: Yeah, get informed whether it's reading forums or books or watching videos, establish and keep up a system that works for you, read up on the disorder and how other people adapt to it, exercise and eat right. Meds have done wonders for me and therapists have introduced me to some good materials to use, but I understand why you could feel skeptical about those, it's ok, take it at your own pace. Sometimes the symptoms can overlap a lot with other mental conditions(particularly trauma or autism) so I would encourage those just in case it's something else, I promise many aren't jews looking to push pills on you (though they certainly exist).

Yes, a shitty lifestlye influences your mental state and brain chemistry but it's simply something beyond willpower and "just doing it". I know you've tried. Knowing the name of the demon helps battle against it, you learn it's got limits and where it can grab you most. Please read instead of getting demoralized by posts on a drug thread of a guyanan spider pedicure auditorium.

For joints your gonna want a filter. You just get a piece of paper thats kinda stiff (like the paper from a zigzag pack) and bend it under and over liek 3 times then roll it into a circle over the bent part and put it in the bottom of the joint paper. He makes a comment about hell being a place where "bad folks go when they die" in the first game (everyone goes to hell when they die in Doom, though... rip), and he's always been a good, virtuous man who stands up to wrongdoers, especially if it means protecting someone else. Time is a flat circle. It's a still image, and to a privileged 4th-dimensional observer, it would all be visible at once. Time doesn't have a timeline of its own whose rules it's subject to. To time itself, there is no time. We experience time linearly in the same way a two-dimensional being would see every sphere as a circle.

That means we're stuck here. Once we get to the end, we loop back around again. Over, and over, and over. There's no end to it. There's no death, no rest, no relief.

Everything that's ever happened to you will happen again. Everything you don't do will never happen. It's pre-ordained. There's no way to change it. *Nothing* you can do.

We are a collection of self-organizing impulses whose only goal is to keep us trapped in this Godless box of self-contained matter for as long as possible. To maximize your awareness of this fact. There's no escape. If you weren't born disabled, be grateful. That's the universe having thrown you a bone. If you were, then I'm truly sorry.

>>71845941
To understand why randomness doesn't exist you only need to look at computers which are quite literally incapable of generating truly random numbers. A computer is a perfect sandbox of simplified conditions, literally the only fundamental two: there is, or there isn't. In a way it's a virtualization of the barest part of our reality. There is no way to create conditions truly independent of outside factors, ie randomness. There is a reason for everything, fundamental rules guiding the state of all things, even those in a superposition. Thank of the chaos theory scene in Jurassic Park

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71845987
Radioactive decay is both spontaneous and unpredictable. Which is to say that it occurs despite any external influences and just when a particle will decay cannot by definition be predicted.

You can make an appeal to special position where if we only knew more of the hidden information about the universe we could predict it. But if in the physical world it is impossible to ever build a computer that could predict radioactive decay then for all intents and purposes it is in fact truly random.

I know it's comforting to think that we live in a clock-makers world, where all of the parts of gods well oiled machine fit together nicely and obey universal laws, but this might not be the case.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71845987
>computer is a perfect sandbox of simplified conditions, literally the only fundamental two: there is, or there isn't

What if I told you that the concept of zero itself is a lie. That there are only various subsets of one. That zero itself is both a part of that one and also not part of it and non-existent. If all that exists is contained within the number 1 then any arbitrary breakdown of that 1 would still be a part of it. We think that there are distinct objects in the world but those objects are always made of lesser parts and themselves part of a greater whole. You consider yourself one "thing" but you are made up of cells and molecules etc. Any boundary set is purely arbitrary. And here lies the problem with postulating the existence of zero. Zero cannot actually be experienced or measured in any sense because the negation of everything cannot be experienced in a universe of something. Once you add anything to zero it is no longer zero. Mathematics as a philosophical outlook for understanding the world relies on it's own metaphysical assumption that zero is an actual thing even though mathematicians themselves have yet to puzzle out just what the hell zero actually is. Which is why they still don't know what the hell dividing by zero means and so forth. It just results in an infinity. And if all of creation is contained within 1 then logically 1 would also be infinite. Or to put it in a more poorly worded way. If 1 in a binary system encompasses everything, then it is infinite. So I suppose my point is that there is no zero state, there is only infinity and the arbitrary sub-sets of infinity that we come up with.

there is a concept in physics called Poincare recurrence, which seems to suggest that the universe will spontaneously reorder itself to any previously held state
however, it requires the universe to have a discrete set of states and all its particles to be bound in a finite space
both of those claims are consistent with our current understanding, but nothing has been conclusively proven yet
even so, the magnitudes involved are so large that you need several lines worth of space just to write out the exponential tower approximating the value
think of it this way, before our universe repeats, everything else that can happen will happen

Oh, and also, something that's often ignored about communism is its focus on sexual equality. China went from having extreme levels of sex-based oppression to being ahead of capitalist Japan on many metrics in just one generation. European nations have a long history of women in power, actually - ruling queens are the most obvious example, which happened far more in Europe than basically anywhere on Earth. But it also filters down to lower levels, where you had a lot more women who were personally powerful as duchesses, countesses, baronesses, et cetera.

It's really quite unique to Europe, aside from a few matriarchal tribal societies elsewhere, and in particular it's unique to Christian Europe as this wasn't present in Roman & Greek society. Women were often the most devoted converts to Christianity at its inception as well, perhaps because the philosophy appealed to them, but for practical reasons as well, as joining a nunnery gave them a degree of control over their lives, their bodies and their personal property that Roman & Greek societies didn't permit.

>>71841999
To develop your Fe, you'd have to understand what Fe is:

> Men and women with extraverted Feeling functions base their decisions on their values, which are determined through their interactions with other people and their assessments of others' needs. Their value systems are heavily influenced by cultural and societal norms, which reveals the outward focus of their feeling function. People in this category are sensitive and empathic and will go to great lengths to help other people in any way they can. (https://www.truity.com/blog/beginners-guide-understanding-mbti-cognitive-functions)

> Extraverted Feeling: Seeks harmony with and between people in the outside world. Interpersonal and cultural values are important. (https://www.myersbriggs.org/my-mbti-personality-type/understanding-mbti-type-dynamics/the-eight-function-attitudes.htm)

> Overall, extraverted feeling is concerned with phenomena to be harmonious with its external environment. Jung writes of extraverted feelers as those where feeling "loses its personal character -- it becomes feeling per se; it almost seems as though the personality were wholly dissolved in the feeling of the moment. Now, since actual life situations constantly and successively alternate, in which the feeling-tones released are not only different but are actually mutually contrasting, the personality inevitably becomes dissipated in just so many different feelings." (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jungian_cognitive_functions#Extraverted_feeling)

The gist of it is to look for social harmony. This can be done by being involved with people around you on a personal level. Caring about their feelings and thoughts.

INFP

>how "real" do online friends feel to you and how much importance do you place them on compared to "real-life" friends
Too real. So real I got disappointed and even just disillusioned when I realized how simply not real it all is. Feeling connected to someone, spending hundreds if not thousands of hours with them, but getting either randomly ghosted, or dropped like a hot potato. Its easy to forget you are interacting with a living being it seems, you become some abstract idea of a person, text on a screen. I do believe you can make true friends online, but it is way harder and the connection will never be able to rival the strength of real life friends you can see and feel physically. An unfortunate realization/experience to make, but one you can not ignore without dire consequences down the line.
All that being said, I still get very attached and they mean a lot to me, I just wish the reverse would be the case more often

>>71839991
>but also something that we don't even suspect might exist
That's part of what I was talking about, I just didn't put it in as clear of terms as you did. By the nature of an object that is intangible and unobservable, it is very likely that we wouldn't even suspect its existence. For example, gravity, there could be some intangible object that causes the force we know as gravity. We cannot observe the object itself, but we can represent its force "gravity" with math. As a result of that, we cannot define any of the attributes of the object that creates the force known as gravity, if it does in fact exist.
>If nobody knows that an object exists, and if it's a complete unknown unknown rather than a known unknown, is it an object?
Yes. But, due to the nature of the object being intangible, it can only be represented in an abstract way, for example, through math, or with some metaphor. So if somehow or another, someone was able to suspect the object existed, there would be no way for them to quantify the object in an objective manner. It would only be able to be represented as a concept or an idea. This is the premise of how theoretical physics works. Theoretical objects that cannot be observed being quantified through mathematics.

Oh, I would have completely changed my life around as soon as I could have. I deserve being ragged on because reality hits like a fucking brick to the mouth.

Here's my advice to anybody reading this. Start on this tomorrow.

> get fit, seriously. not a meme, make exercise a daily thing.
> learn to cook
> learn to do laundry
> develop career skills. if you have a high school diploma or ged, find something else, whether that's a trade or a degree. getting a master's now in my adult career, couldn't have gotten there without a bachelor's. trades are ok too, just have some way to making yourself marketable because you literally cannot survive on a mcdonalds job.
>learn what a 401k is
>learn what a mortgage is
>learn to budget and be frugal. start buying your own food.
>buy ONE entertainment thing per month. that's it.
>learn to fix simple things
>give up alcohol
>don't take any day for granted.

That's a lot, but it's a lot worse when you need to start doing it all at the same time with no warning. If I could do it, you definitely can.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71843864
Here's some very specific advice for each.

>exercise: start with a walk. 1 mile walked OR ran burns about 100 calories. you can't ever out-exercise your diet. walk 2-3 miles per day while listening to some music you like, that's it, takes less than an hour. work your way up, you don't have to become a gymbro immediately.

>cooking: get a cheap instant pot knockoff. there are millions of recipes that are basically "dump ingredients in pot, set timer, eat."

>laundry: wash everything on cold. color separation doesn't matter as much nowadays. put your clothes in the washer, add soap, run on cold or perm-press. beep. put them in the dryer, run for 40 minutes, check. if still wet, run for another 10. repeat until dry.

>career skills: find something that you can enjoy that pays at least $50k. you don't have to be some billionaire crypto bro, just find a way to keep the lights on and get some satisfaction from it. this is the hardest one because it's very personal, and it's ok to try different things until you find a good fit. you just need to keep trying.

>401k: this is a simple conversation with a financial planner. many jobs will provide you with this. you pay a little into it every paycheck, it goes into the stock market, and when you retire you can cash it out.

>mortgage: if you inherit your parents' mortgage, there's a federal act that prevents them from foreclosing on you regardless of your ability to pay. just keep paying if you want to keep it.

>buying food: start spending some of your neetbux on this. cut out one luxury so you can buy some simple ingredients and learn to make something with them.

>budget for entertainment: it's just willpower. find enjoyment in cheaper things, replay old games, rent things from the library if you're really desperate for new stimuli. just learn to give yourself delayed gratification on rewards. entertainment is dessert, not the whole meal.

continued.

>alcohol: it's a trap. seriously, it will slowly and surely erode your life and your health past the point of no return. you owe it to yourself to not be a slave to anybody or anything.

Here's the thing on that - when your parents die, you can inherit their 401ks. I don't have kids but that's absolutely incorrect. My mortgage is $800/mo. I inherited it from my parents so I still have their low interest rate, so that helps, but it's a huge exaggeration to say you need $200k+ per year for a mortgage.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71844084
>Fascinating, tell me more. Your job sounds pretty fucking interesting.
It can be. Basically, we respond every time somebody dies outside of a doctor's care, or in a violent or suspicious way. Most of the deaths I investigate are naturals, as in little old ladies having heart attacks at home. Sometimes I get a more interesting one, like a 35 year old who croaks in a bathroom with no drug or medical history. Those ones usually require autopsies and I assist our pathologist with basic stuff. I've been out to a handful of homicides and they're honestly a pain in the ass because it takes hours for crime scene investigators to finish processing before we can start moving bodies. Nothing sexy like you'd see in national news cases, just a lot of gangbangers killing each other. Suicides, car crashes, all of it gets one of us (I'm on a call rotation with four other people under the ME). I'm currently in a grad program for forensic medicine at the same time as working this job, and by the time I'm done I'll basically qualify for more senior roles in the same industry. ABMDI certifies investigators at two different levels as well, and it's a universal set of skills and training used by coroner and ME offices across the country.

The most satisfying parts are solving medical mysteries and seeing how certain diseases manifest. Had a girl with an eating disorder who died in the bathtub, and actually saw how her stomach was gigantic but her intestines were basically shriveled into nothing (from bulemia). Worst parts of the job are death notifications, being on call for 72 hours at a time once every month (wrapping up my January weekend right now), and having to respond to decomposing alcoholics who croaked in their apartments and rotted into the floors because they had no family or friends. Baby autopsies bother a lot of people but I'm honestly neutral to them - I don't get all freaked out just because it's a baby instead of an adult.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>71844358
Oh, absolutely real, he's one I just had a few months ago. Ended up being a negative autopsy (meaning, no physical abnormalities found like coronary artery disease, heart defects, etc). Process of elimination means that it's likely that it was an arrythmia caused from an electrolyte imbalance, since he also had a past event where he went into vfib from severe hypokalemia due to a longstanding GI issue. Sometimes it's not entirely clear but you have to do the best with the information you have, especially since you can't really run accurate labs after death. To a certain degree you can with vitreous fluid (yes, you get to needle people's eyes), but in this case it was not viable. A lot of death investigation comes down to a person's medical history since even after an autopsy, there are certain things that just can't be seen, like an arrythmia (since that's a conduction issue).

As for the goth chick thing, it's definitely a draw for some, but I'm happily married. If I was single I'd definitely be using it to my advantage, since I happen to definitely like goth girls lol. There's a lot of interest in the industry from witchy zoomers who want internships, but once they smell real decomp or go to an autopsy most quickly lose interest. My wife is a CRNA, so we have the medical stuff in common.
